result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

OFF RECORD 11:19 AM Defendant Carmelita Rhea LaCapa in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson in court for Carmelita Rhea LaCapa.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Def Atty requests a reset. Court resets. Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.
Status conference scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on December 13, 2022 at 11:00 am.

1:35 PM Defendant Carmelita Rhea LaCapa in court.  Attorney Fredric B. Anderson appeared by video for Carmelita Rhea LaCapa.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Anderson  acknowledges information, waives reading.  DEF enters NG plea.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial. Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.   DEF updates telephone number.
Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on September 20, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Converted from CBS $1000 

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Immediately upon release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

11:36 AM Defendant Carmelita Rhea LaCapa in court appearing in person while in custody, with attorney Fredric B. Anderson.  Jennifer Gross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Atty Anderson indicates DEF would like to proceed with preliminary hearing.  11:36AM State calls witness, DET Jay Poplin.  Court swears in witness.  State questions witness.  11:40AM Witness identified DEF.  State continues questioning witness.  11:41AM State tenders witness.  Atty Anderson cross examines witness.  11:42AM Atty Anderson tenders witness.  Witness excused.  State has no additional witnesses.  Atty Anderson has no witness.  State requests bind over.  Atty Anderson has no comment.  Court finds PC and binds DEF over for trial.  Atty Anderson makes statement on bond modification.  State opposes bond modification.  Court addresses DEF, DEF responds.  Court makes statement.  Court grants motion to modify bond.  Court sets ARGN for 5/24/22 at 1:30PM

Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Attny Anderson request preliminary hearing within time limits.    Court takes notice for bail hearing, Court orders Counsel to file bond motion.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.
